Name: By Moon's Fated Light
QuestDesc: With the Sovereign slain, you attend the victory ceremony by invitation of Ceremonial Officer Bruno. The celebration honors the new Hero of Heroes and those who stood by their side amidst the crackling bonfire and joyous cheers of the crowd... Now that the countless petals are to be thrown into the sky to become the rain of glory and triumph, you might finally reunite with the girl you have never forgotten in a way even beyond fate's grasp.

Chapters.Title: Head to the Hunter's Den in the afternoon (14:00-18:00)

Dialogues.Speaker: Worried Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You, my friend, have had one drink too many... Do me a favor, just stop…

Dialogues.Speaker: Worried Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And no more of this nonsense. What if the Priestess right there hears you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Dissatisfied Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Go on, try it if you dare. Just don't get upset when fate scorches the throats of the reckless!

Dialogues.Speaker: Worried Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wh-what?

Dialogues.Speaker: Dissatisfied Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I-I mean, yes of course. I understand.

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Step right up, folks. Best refreshments you can get at the ceremony.

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We got arctic brews of meltwater, or mulled wine made within molten infernos...

Dialogues.Speaker: Solemn Old Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Like the edges of the sun… His father said the same when he earned his first medal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Solemn Old Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And that was before the boy was even born.

Dialogues.Speaker: Solemn Old Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Who knows where that medal went off to? Probably rusting at the bottom of the Dark Tide for all I know…

Dialogues.Speaker: Solemn Old Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's been three full years since Caius last saw his father. Since I saw him… Ethan, my son…

Dialogues.Speaker: Solemn Old Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If he knew his boy dreams of being a fearless warrior like him, the way he looked up to me…

Dialogues.Speaker: Solemn Old Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What would he think?

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh… Tell me, warming wine over a candle flame…

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hic. Does it count as… blasphemy?

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 2
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You, my friend, have had one drink too many... Do me a favor, just stop…

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Caius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Can I touch it? No, wait. Can I try it on...? I'll polish your sheath for you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Honorable Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You know your medals, boy. This here is a Medal of Glory.

Dialogues.Speaker: Honorable Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No need to shine anything. If you want to try it on, tell me this—what's the secret to holding a sword?

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Caius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The secret to holding a sword... Uhh... I...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The little boy struggles to answer and turns to you for help.

Options.PlotLineKey: Hold it steady, like a snake caught in an eagle's talons mid-flight.
Hold it tight, like a tiger sinking its teeth into the throat of its prey.

Dialogues.Speaker: Honorable Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Precisely.

Dialogues.Speaker: Honorable Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's something you only learn after a lot of bruises and a few close calls.

Dialogues.Speaker: Honorable Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for the medal... Here, you can have it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Honorable Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When you've mastered how to wield a sword, you'll come to realize there are many, many things far greater than glory.

Dialogues.Speaker: Novice Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I-I still can't believe it… We really did it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Novice Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A once-in-a-century High Tide. The prophesied end… And it's just...

Dialogues.Speaker: Composed Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, and now it's all over. Just like the other disasters Septimont has faced.

Dialogues.Speaker: Composed Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So long as we carry sword and shield, the only ones we can rely on to save us are ourselves.

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From within Chaos, only those touched by light…

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leads to a future writ in certainty.

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wow, check out that medal you got there... It's as shiny as the edges of the sun!

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Can I touch it? No, wait. Can I try it on...? I'll polish your sheath for you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Eager Merchant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, if it isn't {PlayerName}... What can I get for ya?

Dialogues.Speaker: Eager Merchant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Can I interest you in a meltwater arctic brew? Or a mulled wine made with molten lava? On the house, of course.

Options.PlotLineKey: Arctic brew.
Mulled wine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Eager Merchant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Comin' right up!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The bartender slides the drink your way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You knock it back in one go. It feels like you swallowed an entire glacier.

Dialogues.Speaker: Eager Merchant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Feel that? That's the arctic gale howlin' in your gut!

Dialogues.Speaker: Eager Merchant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Had a fella this morning guzzle a few glasses in a row. He nearly froze the toes off the poor soul next to him just by breathing!

Dialogues.Speaker: Eager Merchant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Comin' right up!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The bartender slides the drink your way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You knock it back in one go. It feels like you swallowed red-hot daggers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Eager Merchant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Feel that? That's a firestorm doin' a war dance in your belly!

Dialogues.Speaker: Eager Merchant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Had a fella this morning chugging glasses like water. His burp nearly set a poor lad's hair on fire!

Chapters.Title: Arrive at the Hunter's Den and take part in the ceremony

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: May joy also be upon you, {PlayerName}.
The Sovereign is dead. Now we pause in our victory to honor the Hero of Heroes, and all those who stood by her side.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ceremonial Officer Bruno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am Bruno, Master of Ceremonies for the occasion. I had hoped to greet you alongside Augusta.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ceremonial Officer Bruno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But she was called away... The Senate insists on wasting her time with their trifles.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ceremonial Officer Bruno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We wish to bestow upon you the honor of Rosebearer. Roses symbolize our glory and triumph, to be shared with all who are gathered here.

Options.PlotLineKey: Rosebearer?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ceremonial Officer Bruno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, it's a ceremonial role. Don't worry, it's pretty simple, and you won't be handing out too many.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ceremonial Officer Bruno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At the height of the celebration, everyone will toss their petals into the air. We will all shower in the flowers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ceremonial Officer Bruno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your task will be to distribute the petals beforehand. You have been chosen by the people, for you are held in the highest regard.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ceremonial Officer Bruno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The people of Septimont gave their all on the battlefield. Now, after fighting side by side, we'll share honey and wine beneath a rain of petals.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ceremonial Officer Bruno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You are our first non-local Rosebearer. But I believe you were already chosen the moment you cut through the Dark Tide's miasma. Without you, the Sovereign's defeat would not have been possible.

Options.PlotLineKey: Eh? You're saying I did that?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ceremonial Officer Bruno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes... Oh, I hope you won't decline. This is not only Augusta's wish, it's the people's too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ceremonial Officer Bruno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When Augusta arrives, she'll join the other Rosebearers. I'm sure those who partook in the hunt will be honored to receive petals from you.

Options.PlotLineKey: I'll give this local tradition a shot.
It would be my honor.
Sounds like a good way to soak in the atmosphere.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ceremonial Officer Bruno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Very well, I'll leave it in your capable hands.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ceremonial Officer Bruno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for who you choose and how, trust your instincts. It's just like a toast, or a Priestess's oration, all part of the celebration. No need to overthink it. Now, enjoy!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With the Sovereign slain, you attend the victory ceremony by invitation of Ceremonial Officer Bruno. The celebration honors the new Hero of Heroes and those who stood by their side. As part of the celebration's highlight, countless rose petals will be thrown into the air in a shower of glory. You accept Bruno's offer to become the first non-local Rosebearer and distribute petals to your allies in tribute to victory.

Chapters.Title: Offer petals to enliven the ceremony

Dialogues.Speaker: Valiant Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To Septimont! To peace after the storm!

Dialogues.Speaker: Outspoken Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes! To the Hero of Heroes, to you, to me, to... Wait, is that {PlayerName}?

Options.PlotLineKey: (Give petals to the Gladiators.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Valiant Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good. When the time comes, I'll hurl the <ano=petals>glory</ano> high and let the wind carry it far. Let the world see our triumph!

Dialogues.Speaker: Outspoken Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since you're here, anything you want to drink? Speak up. Theseus and I will take care of it.

Options.PlotLineKey: I'll drink with you when I'm done.
Thanks, but I'm off to see what else is going on.

Dialogues.Speaker: Valiant Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, we'll catch you after you finish.

Dialogues.Speaker: Outspoken Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Right to the point, huh? Fine. Enjoy yourself. The night's just beginning.

Dialogues.Speaker: Outspoken Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you're interested, you should go listen to the Priestess. Her orations are one of the highlights of the celebration.

Dialogues.Speaker: Valiant Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Who's leading it this time? It's not Lillibet, is it?

Options.PlotLineKey: I already have an idea of who's leading the oration.
So that's why I haven't seen her yet.

Chapters.Title: Hand out petals

Dialogues.Speaker: Worried Noble
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I... I'm still worried. The Paradise was stopped, right? But the Dark Tide isn't gone for good. The Sovereign is gone, but what if something worse is waiting for us?

Dialogues.Speaker: Helpful Noble
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're hopeless. So what if tomorrow's uncertain? Does that mean tonight doesn't matter?

Options.PlotLineKey: We've earned a breather. At least for tonight.
Don't stress about tomorrow. Who knows what's coming anyway?

Dialogues.Speaker: Helpful Noble
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's the spirit. Tonight is for those who've bled for it. All of us!

Dialogues.Speaker: Helpful Noble
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Speaking of which... {PlayerName}, you're here early. Got a little something for us?

Options.PlotLineKey: (Give petals to them.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Helpful Noble
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Knew it! You were always going to be one of the Rosebearers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Worried Noble
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, the fragrance really makes the glory linger... Thank you. Be sure to save some for those who've fought by your side.

Dialogues.Speaker: Helpful Noble
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha! If I were them, I'd gather petals from every bearer, then, when you least expect it... give you a <ano=petal shower>small surprise</ano>!

Options.PlotLineKey: Augusta wouldn't do something like that.
But Iuno might enjoy it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Helpful Noble
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh? Iuno?

Chapters.Title: Continue handing out petals

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's not much left. I'll hand some out over there.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like the oration they mentioned.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh… I thought for sure it'd be Iuno at an event like this.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Eh, well. Guess I'll catch her later.

Dialogues.Speaker: Serene Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Yes, I fear that until Grandmother Lillibet finds a gifted successor, we shall not glimpse further into <ano= Septimont's Auguries>Septimont's future</ano>.

Dialogues.Speaker: Serene Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By the light and fate above us, we are but apprentices carving insights into stone, passing their words along.

Options.PlotLineKey: (Gifted successor? Shouldn't it just be Iuno?)
(Is Iuno no longer serving as Priestess?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Serene Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once, fate flowed like a thread. It guided reverent seekers to glimpse Septimont's end...

Dialogues.Speaker: Serene Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Under the Tide's surge, all was overturned. No soul was spared.

Dialogues.Speaker: Serene Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Until the Unwritten One arrived from afar to join forces with Augusta.

Dialogues.Speaker: Serene Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With the Corrosaurus as bait, {Male=he;Female=she} cut through the Dark Tide's miasma to reveal the truth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Serene Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With the False Sovereign's blood, a new ruler was crowned. The prophesied end was averted, thanks to Augusta and the Unwritten One.

Dialogues.Speaker: Serene Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From now on, fear no longer grips me. The Dark Tide retreats into the forgotten night, and countless souls drink from pure waters again. The new Hero of Heroes, Augusta, shall lead Septimont into a new age.

Dialogues.Speaker: Serene Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thus, the present now aligns with the prophecy Grandmother Lillibet once foresaw in Septimont's Auguries.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Prophecy of the end, and how we managed to lure the Sovereign out... The order and the story are right, but something's missing.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You speak of me and Augusta, but what of Iuno?

Dialogues.Speaker: Serene Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Who is... Iuno?

Options.PlotLineKey: Iuno is Iuno, what do you mean?
Is this supposed to be a joke?

Dialogues.Speaker: Serene Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Unwritten One, you leave me baffled.

Dialogues.Speaker: Serene Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you suggesting that my recounting missed... someone named Iuno? I don't find the name... familiar.

Options.PlotLineKey: You're not just forgetting her in your story.
You speak like you don't know her at all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Serene Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm. I should know this... Iuno, you speak of, yes?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Iuno is a Priestess, just like you.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: More than that, she wielded the Moon Bow and fought alongside me and Augusta in the hunt. We defeated the Sovereign together... Don't you all remember?

Dialogues.Speaker: Serene Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Impossible. As a Priestess myself, I can tell you with certainty that none among us bear that name.

Dialogues.Speaker: Serene Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And, I must remind you, we rarely take part in hunts. Our place is with the <ano=Sacred Flames>flames</ano> in Tetragon Temple.

Dialogues.Speaker: Serene Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The hunt for the Sovereign involved many. Perhaps you are mistaken and confused her for someone else?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, this can't be.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't know what a Priestess is supposed to be, but I do know what Iuno is like. And I'm certain... she's a Priestess.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You mentioned cutting through the Dark Tide's miasma. Tell me, if Iuno wasn't there, then who shot the Moon Arrow?

Dialogues.Speaker: Serene Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Who shot the Moon Arrow...? What do you mean? You were the one who dispelled the miasma.

Options.PlotLineKey: It was... me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Serene Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. On the cliffside, you struck with your sword to cut through the Dark Tide. Don't you remember, Unwritten One?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After distributing some petals, a Priestess's oration catches your attention. Surprisingly, for a ceremony of such significance, Iuno isn't the one hosting. In fact, she isn't mentioned at all. Dispelling the Dark Tide's miasma, her role in the hunt, everything... The Priestess's oration of the battle attributes all of Iuno's contributions to you. No one seems to find this strange. It's as if all memory of Iuno has been erased from the world.

Chapters.Title: Go somewhere quiet to gather your thoughts

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Their accounts are all true, except when it comes to Iuno. How they react to her name is completely wrong.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Everything she did, they attribute to me. They're not just forgetting. It's as if Iuno never existed to them at all.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Could this be possible? This distortion in perception? Is it a remnant of the Sovereign's power? Or is this the work of the Fractsidus again?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Veteran Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I heard what you said to the Priestess, {PlayerName}.

Options.PlotLineKey: You remember Iuno?

Dialogues.Speaker: Veteran Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No... I've never even heard of her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Veteran Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You should know, I've been stationed in this camp longer than most. Memory ain't bad, either.

Dialogues.Speaker: Veteran Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Been thinking... Maybe the Dark Tide's crawled into your head. Could be you're suffering from dissociation, a side effect of all that exposure.

Options.PlotLineKey: Dissociation?

Dialogues.Speaker: Veteran Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Word is, people who get too close end up seeing things. Hallucinations, delusions, the works.

Dialogues.Speaker: Veteran Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Some of 'em go as far as thinking they see the dead. Or worse, some start calling themselves Tacet Discords.

Dialogues.Speaker: Veteran Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sovereign was built from the Dark Tide itself. Who knows what it swallowed before it came for us? Could be worse than what you're used to. You must be in its grip.

Options.PlotLineKey: Do you mean to say I'm the crazy one?
I never heard of this dissociation side effect before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Veteran Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, don't get too worked up. It ain't that bad, not yet anyway.

Dialogues.Speaker: Veteran Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: See, the thing is, it's not like there's one solid name for it. Happens in all kinds of ways, different for each person. And…

Dialogues.Speaker: Veteran Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At any rate, dissociation is just a problem in perception.

Dialogues.Speaker: Veteran Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Some folks let it eat at them for life. Others know what's real and what ain't. They keep away from the Dark Tide, and before long they start feeling alright.

Dialogues.Speaker: Veteran Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How are you feeling? You need to rest up a bit? ...Oh, looks like Augusta's finally here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Veteran Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She's been through it too, faced the Sovereign just like you. If you're still doubting, maybe talk to her. Could help.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your mind swirls with questions, but no answers come. An elder at the camp notices your unease and gently explains that what you're experiencing may be a side-effect of prolonged Dark Tide exposure—hallucinations, confusion, delusions. He reassures you that these symptoms aren't permanent, and simply avoiding the Dark Tide should let you recover. He suggests speaking with Augusta, who went through the Dark Tide alongside you and might offer some clarity.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, you've come.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bruno has already filled you in on the Rosebearer matter, yes? How are the celebrations treating you?

Options.PlotLineKey: I have something more pressing to discuss with you.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Augusta, do you remember Iuno?

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Iuno?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, she was often by your side. The one with the bow like the moon. She joined our hunt for the Sovereign...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everyone has forgotten... No, that's not it. Everyone says they've never even seen her before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But you, you remember her. You remember everything that happened. You are certain she is real and cannot exist in your memories alone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know what you're feeling, because I've felt it too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Dark Tide's frequencies twisted my perception as well. Made me see things that weren't real.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sovereign's whispers dogged me for decades, tempting me to accept its gift.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But that's all in the past. I know now that to find peace, I must see through the deception, fight it, and conquer it.

Options.PlotLineKey: How can you be sure it's deception?

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Because of my sword. It reflects everything that happened in Murmurstown.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Existence always leaves a trace. Beyond feeling, memory, and perception, is there anything that can prove this "Iuno" isn't an illusion?

Options.PlotLineKey: This bracelet... Yes, this bracelet!
I tried to return this to her once...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After this, I shall likely sleep like I've never slept before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Say, I heard the Montelli family imported some device that aids sleep. It's all the rage... Augusta, I trust you will acquire one for me? I wish to try it myself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Scented candles are fine, though the scent of the forest is most pleasing. As for pillows and bedding...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's enough. I allow requests... but only three.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmph. Apologies, but I need my rest if I'm to be at full power. Do bear with it. It's for your own good, after all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And you, {PlayerName}? Were I to indulge in a bit of selfishness, you'd forgive me, wouldn't you?

Options.PlotLineKey: Saying that in itself is rather selfish.
Depends on how selfish you get.
No, I wouldn't.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh? Didn't think the great "Unwritten {PlayerName}" would be so stingy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, lucky for you, I'm feeling generous today. Now, what brings you to me?

Options.PlotLineKey: You can have this back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Really? You traveled all this way just to return what I gave you, is that it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Was it truly such a burden for you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If one day this bracelet becomes meaningless to anyone else, I hope you will remain the exception, Unwritten One.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... perhaps in that distant future, forgetting might prove far easier than remembering. Never mind. In any case, you are not to return it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's something I've carried with me ever since I was bestowed the title of Priestess. Keep it for me, if only as a keepsake.

Options.PlotLineKey: For how long must I keep it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, until we meet again, I suppose.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This bracelet belongs to Iuno.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Quite the unique design. Like a crescent moon. But still... I'm sorry.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I wish I could offer you the answer you seek, but to me, it's just an ordinary bracelet. Nothing about it stands out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When you mentioned her name, I tried to recall any trace of her in my memories.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But there is nothing. What has passed is clear... and she feels like an extra piece to a puzzle, one that doesn't quite fit.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How can this be? You spent the most time with her.

Options.PlotLineKey: Iuno?

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, wait...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What... did you see?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Knowing how close Augusta and Iuno are, you look to her for confirmation. But what she says shocks you. She believes your memory of "Iuno" is a product of the Whisper's deceptions, a false memory to be resisted. You try to prove Iuno is real by showing her Iuno's Lunarum bracelet. During the hunt, you had tried to return it to Iuno, but she insisted you keep it as a memento. Did she somehow already know she would be forgotten? Just then, light spills from the bracelet to form a specter of Iuno. But Augusta sees nothing at all.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Iuno.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course, only you would be the exception.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So you've known this all along...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A death that shouldn't have happened, traded for an unforetold victory. A fair deal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now... I am but a fading sliver of moonlight.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm sorry, but...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even I fear being...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Forgotten...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, {PlayerName}, you alright? You've been standing here for ages.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So Iuno's really gone? Just like that?

Options.PlotLineKey: You still remember her too?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Duh! Even though I was snoozing on and off... I still remember everything that went down, crystal clear!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You told me the first time you met Iuno was in the arena, right? She scared the toga off that other team with just a few words. Intimidating stuff. But when I actually met her, she was...

Options.PlotLineKey: She only seems like she has an attitude.
She's unexpectedly open and straightforward.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, totally! We had so much done with her during the hunt trip.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She even invited us to Tetragon Temple to check out the murals. Oh, and we caught that giant blue spiky TD, which led us to that big bad stinky thing...

Options.PlotLineKey: We faced the Sovereign's ambush together, too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yep, and I'm pretty sure she was the one who took that Moon Bow and blasted the Dark Tide wide open! Not you, not anyone else!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And that bracelet, she gave it to us to lure out that nasty big fella... Even asked us to keep it for her...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So it doesn't matter whatever anyone thinks, or... or what happened to her. You remember her, and I do too! It wasn't some made-up crap!

Options.PlotLineKey: Iuno said she traded her life for our victory...
Iuno said only I would be the exception...
Iuno said she didn't want to be forgotten...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Iuno once said she glimpsed the end, where she would be the last one standing. But now, this end never came... and Iuno is dead.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is this the cost of changing destiny? Did she know she'd disappear, but accepted it anyway?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why am I special? Why has everyone forgotten everything about Iuno except me?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But if I'm the exception, if I'm the only one who still remembers... does that mean there's something I can do about it?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She didn't even get to finish her sentence. What was she thinking? Why did she do it... If this is the end, maybe I'll never know.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, I know what you mean... Like, we didn't even get to have a proper goodbye!

Options.PlotLineKey: I can't accept this as the end.
I need to know how it all happened.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't care if Iuno foresaw her fate and chose this path for herself.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All I know is I won't let it end like this. Not with her fading into oblivion.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why did Iuno choose this? Did she truly believe this was the better ending?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm the one she entrusted with her bracelet. The exception. So it's on me to find the answer.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Like Augusta said, everything that exists leaves a trace. Since she's a Priestess, I'm sure to find traces of her in Tetragon Temple.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A lead could be the breakthrough I need.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's the spirit! Look at ya, {PlayerName}, snapping out of that funk! Knew you'd be back at it soon enough!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I still got some kinks to work out before I'm in my Super Echo Abby form, but you can bet I'll be here...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Remembering everything that happens. We'll figure something out, whatever it takes! Even when I'm just riding along, I'm in this with you, pal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're unable to accept Iuno's disappearance, but doubt flickers through your mind... Was it all an illusion? Now that even Iuno's last sliver of moonlight fades, your memories are the only proof she ever existed. Abby reassures you that it also remembers everything about Iuno and all the moments you shared. As the only exception left, you refuse to accept this ending. You decide to search Tetragon Temple for any remaining traces of her.

Chapters.Title: Return to Tetragon Temple and look for more clues about Iuno
Look around and see what's going on

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Strange... Lillibet and the other Priestesses aren't here. The Temple seems empty.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Hmm? Iuno's bracelet is shining? The light is... pointing at a wall?)

Chapters.Title: Touch the wall illuminated by the light
Investigate the area behind the secret door
Return to Tetragon Temple's upper floor

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My apologies. I should've been here to receive you, but some Priestesses ran into some trouble... I had to step away.

Options.PlotLineKey: What trouble?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Simply put, aside from what's already been verified, we can no longer see any other of Septimont's Auguries.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The full scope has always been out of reach, but this feeling of being blocked by an impenetrable white barrier is something I've never encountered. It's as if there's nothing there at all.

Options.PlotLineKey: All the Priestesses' abilities have failed?
Can you still make prophecies?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, there is a silver lining. Septimont's Auguries concern Septimont's future, but as for smaller, individual futures... we can still see those.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For instance, I saw Avidius making a commotion not long ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But let's talk about why you are here first. Augusta mentioned your situation and said you might come looking for me. You seek help in finding a Priestess by the name of Iuno.

Options.PlotLineKey: Iuno once lived and breathed in this world.
Everyone's forgotten her. Except for me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I wish she were a figment of your imagination. A product of your proximity to the Dark Tide. That would make things much simpler.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Because I did find a record of a Priestess named Iuno.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But according to the record, she died three years ago. Buried where the Dark Tide swallowed the spring basin.

Options.PlotLineKey: How did she die? And why?
A death that shouldn't have happened. Is that a coincidence...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The record didn't say, but...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You must understand, "death" and "disappearance" are two different concepts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If Iuno truly died three years ago, then she couldn't have been your companion three years later, let alone have existed up until today.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In other words, if Iuno disappeared today and was erased from the memories of Augusta, myself, and everyone else, then the death three years ago must have been a fabrication.

Options.PlotLineKey: Can you say that again, but in simple terms?
What does it mean if her death was a fabrication?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It means her death three years ago and her disappearance today cannot both be true.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If someone has truly disappeared from this world, do they need a fabricated death? Likewise, when someone dies, they no longer exist in a way that others can feel. These two causal chains should be clear, but they crossed paths with you, the unknowable void.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Although I hate to admit it, Avidius was right... Since you still remember Iuno and thus hold onto that last connection between her and the world, you've essentially "anchored" her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This has caused the causal chain to become tangled. The ending is still unwritten. Right now, she is but a specter, stuck reliving her past in the Chaos between life and death, between existence and non-existence.

Options.PlotLineKey: And I can choose which causal chain to keep.
What if I enter the Chaos myself...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In theory, yes. You could forget her, let her disappear entirely. Or, you could forget her and let her die for good.

Options.PlotLineKey: Is there really no other way?
What if neither of those work for me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I believe insight into fate is not to tempt one's defiance. It will move according to its intended end.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Besides, it's already granted you a rare gift—two options. More than most ever get.

Options.PlotLineKey: Then I'll make my own deal with fate.
I refuse to let fate dictate my choices.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So you wish to use yourself as a vessel to anchor the memories, feelings, and connections with Iuno in the Chaos, manifesting her back into existence?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anchor, manifest, whatever you want to call it. All I know is Iuno's not gone because of me. So why shouldn't I be able to bring her back?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If I can tangle the causal chain, why can't I create a new possibility?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your thinking is... bold, to say the least.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But do you really understand? Chaos isn't just disorder. It's the aggregation of all things. A web of cause and effect, the convergence of infinite possibilities. If you end up lost within it, you risk being consumed, never to return.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even ones such as we, guided by fate, can only pull small insights from certain shores of destiny. What if you enter only to find that you cannot bring Iuno back?

Options.PlotLineKey: But you didn't say I can't enter.
So just tell me how to do it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Chaos isn't a place in the usual sense. The key to entering isn't about where you are, but what's happening and what you do in that moment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I suspect that three years ago, this Priestess must have done something that defied fate, which set the course for her inevitable disappearance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you can get close to that inescapable knot in the causal chain, maybe you'll find a way in.

Options.PlotLineKey: Then I'll go to the place where the record said she died.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lillibet reveals two important truths. First, Septimont's future is now veiled behind a white barrier. For the first time, none of the Priestesses can see any of Septimont's Auguries. Second, after hearing from Augusta about your unwavering belief in Iuno's existence, she uncovered a single record: a Priestess named Iuno who died three years ago. But death and disappearance cannot both be true. Your lone memory of Iuno has disrupted the causal chain, creating a reality suspended in limbo. Refusing to accept this ending, you resolve to bring Iuno back from the Chaos between life and death, between existence and non-existence, by using the same method that once gave form to Avidius.

Chapters.Title: Head to the place mentioned in the record where Iuno died

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even with no certainty, you're still heading toward that deathtrap...  {PlayerName}, you've made up your mind, haven't you?

Options.PlotLineKey: Yes, let's go. The quicker the better.
I still need a moment to prepare.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I understand. One must try at least... Very well, I'll accompany you there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course. But if you truly are to face Chaos, no amount of preparation will ever be enough.

Chapters.Title: Head to the place mentioned in the record where Iuno died

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is where the record says she died, three years ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nothing here... Well, that's okay. You tried, {PlayerName}.

Options.PlotLineKey: No. We've already come this far.
Did we take the wrong path?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Guided by the light of fate, we walk the web of futures. Many seek prophecies to follow or to break free from... all in pursuit of harmonious completeness.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've never doubted your judgment of Iuno. But if, as you say, she knew what would happen and still chose this path... could it be that this was the closest she could get to true completeness?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you refuse this ending, how can you be certain that you can create a better one?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A life with all its experiences and feelings, shredded, scattered, and thrown into the realm of Chaos... What you find there may not be beautiful. It will be filled with pain and emptiness.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even if you do find a way in, your time together may be brief.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With so much uncertainty, do you still feel that you must go?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If there were any doubt, now... Now I'm sure.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait, you—

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm not rejecting the ending Iuno wrote. I just want to fix the regret she left behind.

Options.PlotLineKey: This is not about her, but me.
Because this ending wasn't fair.
Because I don't want her to go like this.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This isn't the ending I'm happy with, that's all.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An unnecessary death traded for an unforetold victory... She gave everything for Septimont only to be forgotten.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's a fate no one should suffer. Not her, not anyone.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've only just begun our story. The future I want... is one where she's there with all of us.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Forgetting may be easier than remembering. But let that be the choice of someone alive, not one who's already gone.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Right now I... don't want to lose anything I still have.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The secret to anchoring, lies in connection and its manifestation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you can find what remains of her in the Chaos, and she responds to you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lillibet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then follow her guidance. For that will be the only fragile rope connecting you, her, and this world.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The realm of Chaos isn't entered by location, but through a causal "knot," a specific intersection of circumstance and action. You and Lillibet travel to the site of Iuno's recorded death three years ago, but find nothing unusual. Just as doubt begins to creep in, you notice the corrupted moon above. Once again, a trail of moonlight appears, guiding you toward a specter of Iuno—and deeper into the Dark Tide. You don't hesitate. Though uncertain of what you're seeing, Lillibet knows she can no longer stop you. She offers one final piece of advice: "If you find what remains of her in the Chaos, follow her guidance."

Dialogues.Speaker: Voice in the Chaos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Endlessly cycling... shattering futures... Is this Chaos?

Dialogues.Speaker: Voice in the Chaos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Unsalvageable, fractured into pieces... This is Chaos!

Dialogues.Speaker: Voice in the Chaos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Countless possibilities, both true and not true... This is Chaos...

Dialogues.Speaker: Voice in the Chaos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Until every Anchor is revealed, laid bare in the light.

Chapters.Title: Enter the Chaos
Arrive at Chaos

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can't see where it ends. Can't tell where I am, either.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is this the Chaos between life and death, between existence and non-existence?

Chapters.Title: Follow the moonlight
Follow the moonlight
Follow the moonlight

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's Iuno in the center!

Chapters.Title: Approach the mysterious entity
Clear the surrounding Dark Tide creations
Awaken Iuno

Options.PlotLineKey: Iuno, are you...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Iuno? You're... calling me? Are you here for me?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why... would someone be looking for me?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (She looks the same as she did when she faded away... a sliver of moonlight. How long has she been lost in this Chaos?)

Options.PlotLineKey: I'm sorry. I've come late.
I'm here for you. Everything is going to be okay.
Do you... still remember me?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know you.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You are... Unwritten. A blank...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An unwritten... blank.

Options.PlotLineKey: Your new nickname for me?
You can call me whatever you want.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mmm. Unwritten.

Options.PlotLineKey: Do you...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will guide the <ano=you>Unwritten</ano> with the moonlight.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To find more of... me.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (She responded to me... Now she's guiding me.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Even if it's just a trace of her, I found her. Now that fragile rope connecting her, me, and the world... is already in my hands.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Iuno's specter takes shape before you in the Chaos. You don't know how long she's been lost here, but it's clear she's no longer whole. She calls you an "unwritten blank" and reaches out her hand. You're unsure how to anchor Iuno back into existence, but the moment your hands meet, you know it has begun. You've found a trace of Iuno, and now she's guiding you to find the rest.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Where are you taking me?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mmm... Just don't let go of my hand.

Chapters.Title: Take Iuno's hand and continue forward

Dialogues.Speaker: Devoted Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Guided by the light of fate, we walk the web of futures. Grandmother Lillibet has already prophesied her successor. Iuno, born in a lunar eclipse, will become a "prodigy" Priestess.

Dialogues.Speaker: Questioning Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait, Sibylla's Iuno? I know that girl... wild and dramatic. She's just won a handful of matches.

Dialogues.Speaker: Questioning Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you think she'll really come to Tetragon Temple? Her mother is a former Gladiator champion, and her father a famed blacksmith. She's already from a highly respectable family.

Dialogues.Speaker: Questioning Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And she is skilled with a bow. Maybe she'll just want to be the next champion, you know? She is spoiled for choice...

Dialogues.Speaker: Devoted Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The prophecy can't be wrong. Grandmother Lillibet's already seen it!

Dialogues.Speaker: Devoted Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She'll resonate with the moon's phases... That's a huge honor! Not just anyone can see fate's patterns, and she'll be able to see it more clearly than the rest of us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Devoted Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's our duty to share visions of the future to guide Septimont and its people forward. Such glory... She won't refuse, and she shouldn't.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is the past. Where my existence left its mark.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see. Grandmother Lillibet said that the key to Anchoring lies in connection and its manifestation. Let's try to find more.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You and Iuno's specter journey deeper into the Chaos, seeing memories of her past unfold around you. From whispers among the Priestesses, you learn of a prophecy tied to her birth. Lillibet once remarked that Iuno, born during a lunar eclipse, was destined to be a prodigy among Priestesses. Whether she would rise as the next great champion or follow the fate written for her, one thing was clear: the bold, willful Iuno was never bound to a single path.

Chapters.Title: Take Iuno's hand and continue forward

Dialogues.Speaker: Excitable Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can't see it! It's gone after that... Gone forever... Hah! Just one desecration is enough for the ordinary...

Dialogues.Speaker: Excitable Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I just wanted to understand! To look at it! To see the blinding flames! I was so close to seeing the outcome, to tracing back the cause!

Dialogues.Speaker: Excitable Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You... you must be smarter than me, stronger than me... Tell me... Did I do it right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Excitable Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Staring at the sun, burning with pain for that truth... Tell me, have I gone mad? Is it me who's... gone mad?

Options.PlotLineKey: Could this be another mark of Iuno's existence?

Chapters.Title: Find Iuno and take her hand
Move through the gap and continue forward

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're nearly there.

Chapters.Title: Find Iuno and take her hand
Take Iuno's hand and continue forward

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's go before Chaos catches up to us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You can't track 'em, can't lock 'em down... The only thing that barely reveals them is the moon... What the hell are we supposed to do?

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We keep moving. No matter what, we move forward. Until we can't anymore.

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fear not, Andrius. The Priestesses already spoke of our victory.

Dialogues.Speaker: Startled Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sibylla, wait!

Dialogues.Speaker: Startled Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you crazy? Charging off alone is walking to your death! Think about your daughter, she's still waiting for you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Indomitable Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Spare me your words! The entire western defense rests on us. Do you have a better plan?

Dialogues.Speaker: Indomitable Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for death... Of course I want to live. I fight not with death in mind, but victory!

Dialogues.Speaker: Indomitable Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yet, if glory and death come hand in hand, so be it. Let the bells toll, and mourn me when the time comes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Indomitable Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Until that moment, I will not stop.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is this... how it was...?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Or... is this just my imagination?

Options.PlotLineKey: Do you want to say something to her?
So, Sibylla's Iuno, am I correct?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's happened is done... It can't be changed.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those who closed their eyes never truly saw... So, this isn't really her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your anchoring with Iuno continues. In another memory, you witness a female Gladiator charging into a battlefield corrupted by the Dark Tide. From her name and title, you sense her connection to Iuno, but when you suggest approaching her, Iuno's specter refuses. These visions in the Chaos aren't entirely real—they're shaped by Iuno's own memories and perceptions. For someone who once kept her eyes closed to the truth, she can neither see things as they truly were nor change what has already passed. You see deep pain in her eyes.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Iuno!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, Unwritten.

Options.PlotLineKey: Stay close to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mm, I won't let go. I don't want to let go.

Chapters.Title: Find Iuno and take her hand
Take Iuno's hand and continue forward

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that...

Chapters.Title: Take Iuno's hand and continue forward

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, there you are. Been waiting for you, Iuno.

Options.PlotLineKey: ...Iuno?
You can see her?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's the surprise? You're Iuno, aren't ya? Been hammerin' away at this bow for you long enough. If I couldn't call you by name now, well, that'd be a proper surprise.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Her? Is there anyone else besides you here, Iuno?

Options.PlotLineKey: (Maybe it's because I'm Anchored to Iuno?)
(Here, I really am Iuno.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, you came for the bow I promised you, eh? Still want it?

Options.PlotLineKey: Why wouldn't I want it?
Should I want it?
Is the bow really that important?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha! Right you are. Why wouldn't you want it? But once you take it, what then?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's not a question for me. That's a question for yourself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What truly counts as "important"? Even the finest bow or sword... is just a weapon. Doesn't matter much if you don't use it in a fight.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I reckon you've heard Lillibet's prophecy, haven't you? What do you think?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can't picture you as one of those serious Priestesses in the Temple... stuck in there with your scrolls and your candles and your tablets. Doesn't seem right for someone with a spirit like yours.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And if you really did become a Priestess... well, this bow wouldn't be of much use, would it? No time for it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But you've got a gift that other Priestesses could only dream of. Such a shame to waste it... And the warriors of Septimont need their Priestesses, so do Septimont's Auguries.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lillibet and the others still fail to foresee the entirety of the coming disaster.

Options.PlotLineKey: (Of all times, Iuno chooses now to go silent...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aye, well, it's not my place to say. You make up your own mind, and that's all that matters. As for me? I make weapons. If you still want the bow, I'll forge it for you. But the materials... Well, you'll have to gather those yourself.

Options.PlotLineKey: Materials? What do you mean?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh, forgetful today, are we? Didn't you say you wanted to craft a bow from your favorite Lunarum Bough?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Truth be told, making a bow isn't all that different from making anything else. You learn as much as you can, repeat it often enough, until you've shaped it just right.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From nothing to something, to its final existence... that's how it's always been, eh? But like I said, if you still want it, you'll need to gather the materials first.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When you've gathered enough Lunarum Bough, you'll get your bow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And if you're not sure where to look for it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There, see it? Just head that way and you'll see!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You continue forward and meet a blacksmith who mistakes you for Iuno, perhaps a result of the anchoring. He asks whether you still plan to become a Priestess or choose another path, but offers no advice. Instead, he reminds you of the bow you once asked him to craft. Like anything else, creation takes knowledge and the right steps to take form. He tells you that if you can gather enough Lunarum Bough, he'll forge the bow for you, and then opens a path deeper into the Chaos.

Chapters.Title: Walk towards the light

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lunarum Bough... that's what the blacksmith mentioned. Looks just like what was used for your bow.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …Mm.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Up ahead, it looks like... two chairs?

Chapters.Title: Head to where the Lunarum Bough is
Sit by the Lunarum Bough

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Chaos won't disturb us here.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sitting just like that, huh? You're still just as... spontaneous.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Shh, Unwritten.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's time for a rest. Come sit with me.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've never said it properly before, and I don't know if you fully understand it now... but now that I've found you, I will bring you back. I won't stop until I do.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Because you said it, I believe you.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We rest to manifest what we've already found.

Options.PlotLineKey: Manifest? How?

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Come on! Don't bore me this quickly. Show me what other tricks you've got up your sleeve."
"Victory? That's the only befitting outcome."
"Now spare me the words. I know I'll be first."
"This is only the beginning. Soon... I'll be an even greater warrior than Mother ever was."
"Getting whatever she wants, doing whatever she sets her mind to... Are you talking about me? Very well, I'll prove you right."
"Prodigy, you say? If you want to call me that... I'll gladly take it."
"But why are you so certain... that who you see is me?"
"That... that was..."
"Huh? They're gone now..."
"...Because this is fate's will. It has favored me more than others."
"...Because I can see what others cannot. Only I can see farther... But..."

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You look like you're recovering.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So after experiencing and feeling all that, you need to rest... among Lunarum Boughs, to make what's Anchored become a part of you?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Exactly. After manifestation, this is how I can absorb more.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Only then can I find… a more complete me.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Unwritten, you... are a clever one.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You reach a shallow pool and sit down to rest beside Iuno's specter. Her bracelet begins to glow, releasing memories of the past: A young Iuno celebrates a victory gladiating and runs into her mother's arms, only to see her consumed by the Dark Tide. She wonders why fate chose her, and what the cost truly was. The memory ends suddenly. From the pool, golden Lunarum Bough begins to grow, and Iuno's specter becomes a little more whole. Anchoring her back into existence is working.

Chapters.Title: Find Iuno and take her hand

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We can't continue the Anchoring.

Chapters.Title: Find Iuno and take her hand
Take Iuno's hand and continue forward
Make your choice before the gate of fate

Options.PlotLineKey: Follow the foretold fate
Ignore the foretold fate

Dialogues.Speaker: Possible Choice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "As the prophecy says, I cannot waste my talents. I will not turn a blind eye to misfortune. Since only I can do this, I'll be the one to see it through!"

Dialogues.Speaker: Possible Choice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "A Gladiator or Priestess, what does it matter? I'll face fate and see just how far I can go!"

Dialogues.Speaker: Possible Choice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Let's go. Forget the prophecies, forget being a Priestess. Let's do what we truly want. If the future is a question, the answer's never in what others define."

Dialogues.Speaker: Possible Choice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "If we don't want to walk a determined path, then let's steer clear and try something we've never even seen before."

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anchoring cannot continue.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There are countless possibilities, but what's done is done. Only one past can bring you to the present you seek.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The light from the bracelet leads you to two doors. To accept the fate that was seen, or turn away from it. To face a predetermined path, or hide from it. The possibilities are endless. But like Iuno once did, you know you must make a choice.

Chapters.Title: Make your choice before the gate of fate

Options.PlotLineKey: (Follow the foretold fate.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Possible Choice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "As the prophecy says, I cannot waste my talents. I will not turn a blind eye to misfortune. Since only I can do this, I'll be the one to see it through!"

Dialogues.Speaker: Possible Choice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "A Gladiator or Priestess, what does it matter? I'll face fate and see just how far I can go!"

Chapters.Title: Become the Priestess

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Anchoring is still working. This looks like a memory from when you became a Priestess.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Isn't that... the agora in Aeterna Square? I think I'd like to see it.

Chapters.Title: Continue walking towards the square

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Back then, it seems you didn't mind giving prophecies. The people were much closer to you than they are now.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Over there. That was my divination altar.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They're waiting for the Priestess's words. I must... go and deliver it.

Chapters.Title: Sit on the divination altar with Iuno
Find Iuno and take her hand

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh, you look unfamiliar. Not from Septimont, I take it?

Options.PlotLineKey: Iuno... have you returned to your true form?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not bad. You even bothered to learn my name.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An outlander coming all this way, seeking the most gifted Priestess—me—just to beg for answers about the future.

Options.PlotLineKey: Ah. You're still not fully recovered...
More like I've come to beg for answers about the past.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm? What's this about? How dreadfully complicated... But I suppose I can't fault your luck, finding your way to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They say a Priestess can't see everything, but when she does, she's always right. But I'm different. I can see everything, and I'm always right.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even when I'm not in the Temple bathed in flame, I've more than enough power to see your future. So far, nothing's happened that I didn't already foresee.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, hand over whatever item you've brought. I'll see what's been bothering you.

Options.PlotLineKey: I didn't bring anything.
I don't have time for this. I'm trying to...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh? That's alright. I hope you're okay with me freestyling it then.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Shh, quiet please... And don't you dare look away. I'm about to...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What? I see... a void?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can't see your past. I can't see your present... and your future... How can this be?!

Options.PlotLineKey: Like you said, I'm the Unwritten One.
You can't see everything now, can you?
Unsurprising, considering we're not technically alive.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Unwritten One. Why is that familiar... Who exactly are you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You! You... No, it can't be. Let me try again—

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Think you're funny, hmm? We're both sitting here, perfectly normal. If this isn't alive, then—

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}? You... why are you here? Isn't this... Aeterna Square?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did something happen in Septimont? Is it Augusta or the others? No, that's impossible... I should've disappeared by now. Why do I feel so tired? Like I'm walking the same path, over and over again without end...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why do I see so many memories from the past? My mother, the other Priestesses... and you. You've done something for me, haven't you?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. We're in the Chaos now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But you shouldn't be here. Neither should I. Why haven't I disappeared completely?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why did you sacrifice yourself? Why did you just leave without a word? Was this really the outcome the most gifted Priestess chose for herself?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Because this was the best I could do for Septimont.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Destruction, failure, oblivion... the Dark Tide devours everything you can imagine. The Gryphons can't escape it. The Gladiators can't defeat it. In the blink of an eye, before we could even react, it had already enveloped everything.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I knew it from the start.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I knew three years ago, I would turn everything I am into the Moon Arrow that would pin down the Sovereign. I just didn't know when that day would come, or if it would be enough...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Until I saw you. You, the one who stood between me and the manipulating hand behind everything. Just like the faint light I once saw in the future.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I finally understand. My defiance, my sacrilege... it was all worth it. Now I... I found the answer.

Options.PlotLineKey: So you're just giving up?
Let me show you what a better outcome looks like.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whether it's because of the void I carry, or whatever else it may be, I still remember you. Your place in this world isn't over yet.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm taking you out of this realm of Chaos.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Seems like I missed something. Something I didn't foresee. So, the Unwritten One from the future isn't happy with the ending I've changed and wants to rewrite it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The battle's still undecided. The war isn't finished yet, is that it?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. You traded your existence to alter the prophecy. But I'll Anchor your existence and rewrite your ending.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If I've ever guided you before, then now, let me guide you one more time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Really?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll entrust myself to you, then.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But be careful, {PlayerName}. Don't get lost in the Chaos. And I shall put my best foot forward as well... We shall meet at the very end.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait... Am I Iuno now?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
The moment you sit at the divination altar, everything around you shifts. You find yourself in what appears to be a moment of the past, face-to-face with a living Iuno who's caught in a looping memory. She reaches for your hand to read your fate, but the instant your fingers touch, her lost memories come rushing back. Why are you here? And why hasn't she vanished from existence?

Realizing you entered Chaos to help her, Iuno chooses to go along with your attempt to rewrite her ending. She promises to meet you again at the very end. As her voice fades into the air, your vision shifts once more. This time, it feels like you have truly become Iuno.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gladiator Harelius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hello, Priestess. Uh... I've got the item here with me. I hope you can take a look for me.

Options.PlotLineKey: What do you want with Iuno... I mean, what is it?
I can't promise anything, but show it to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gladiator Harelius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My squad and I were once ambushed in Cassos. A monstrous Tacet Discord never seen before appeared in the Dark Tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gladiator Harelius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I seek guidance on what comes next. Will we have the strength to battle it?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Are these the types of visions Iuno sees?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The broken horn, the spear piercing through the eye... Victory, cheering, you... and the other Gladiators... There's blood, but they all survive...)

Options.PlotLineKey: (Objectively recount what you saw.)
(Consider the potential possibilities.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (A Priestess would probably relay her visions as they were, without any omissions or additions.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Seeing the outcome gives new information. Now, their future is both certain and uncertain. Knowing it ahead of time lets them prepare, and with that, gain the upper hand.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Gladiator Harelius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...The beast falls, and we are cheering. Its eye is pierced by a spear, its horn is broken... So that's its weak spot. Is that the key to our victory?

Dialogues.Speaker: Gladiator Harelius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, Priestess Iuno! Your words put my mind at ease.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gladiator Harelius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Can I... come see you again once it's all over?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
As Priestess Iuno of the past, you sit on the altar offering prophecies to those who seek guidance.

The first to come is Harelius, a Gladiator in search of strategic insight for his squad and their mission to confront a monstrous Tacet Discord never before seen in the Dark Tide.
The second to come is Samara, a lovestruck woman holding a bracelet. She...
The third to come is Nikolas, a noble youth desperate to outwit fate. He...
The fourth to come is Maia, a young, innocent girl. She..

Dialogues.Speaker: Infatuated Samara
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Priestess Iuno? I'm here with a bracelet my betrothed gave me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Infatuated Samara
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I feel like it best captures his feelings for me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Infatuated Samara
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps... our future together will be one of true love? Where we grow old together?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Pain or conflict... confusion, shattered hopes... They don't look that old. Not much time has passed... Is that their child?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (It's not as clear as the last one. All I can tell is that their love doesn't end well. But it's obvious she's hoping for a better ending.)

Options.PlotLineKey: (Speak the truth about what you saw.)
(Offer hints to leave space for her to choose her path.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (A happy ending gives peace. A painful one serves as a warning. Both hold meaning. The rest... is in her hands.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Infatuated Samara
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...You're saying we won't be together forever? That it ends... badly? Are you sure you're not mistaken?

Dialogues.Speaker: Infatuated Samara
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We met at the academy, how could we drift apart? I... I don't believe it. Surely there's some explanation?

Dialogues.Speaker: Infatuated Samara
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You said we had a child. Maybe he was just going on a trip. Maybe it wasn't a permanent separation.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (If a Priestess's vision is never wrong, then telling her won't change a thing. But what if it's the act of telling her this prophecy that causes that ending?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (She should decide the path she wants, regardless of the outcome. I'll just let her enjoy the present.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Infatuated Samara
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...So, not much else to see? You want me to focus on the present... Well, we are very happy now. I... feel very lucky.

Dialogues.Speaker: Infatuated Samara
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I really never thought we'd end up together. We've known each other for a long time, but we're both so strong-willed... I came here because I was worried about our future.

Dialogues.Speaker: Infatuated Samara
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What matters is that we're in love now. Whatever comes, I don't want to let him go.

Dialogues.Speaker: Infatuated Samara
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And thank you, Priestess Iuno. No matter what, thank you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
As Priestess Iuno of the past, you sit on the altar offering prophecies to those who seek guidance.

The second to come is Samara, a lovestruck woman. She presents a betrothal bracelet from her fiancé, hoping you can foresee whether their love will endure forever.
The third to come is Nikolas, a noble youth desperate to outwit fate. He...
The fourth to come is Maia, a young, innocent girl. She...

Dialogues.Speaker: Clever Nikolas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have a little trick I'd like to pull off, regarding a life. That's why I've come to you, Priestess Iuno. I'm curious if your prophecy can confirm whether it's possible.

Options.PlotLineKey: A trick? A Priestess's visions don't deal in trivialities.
Let's hear it. What do you want me to do?

Dialogues.Speaker: Clever Nikolas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't be so hasty to dismiss me. What if the trick I wish to pull off is against fate itself?

Dialogues.Speaker: Clever Nikolas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Have you never questioned whether it could be deceived or defied?

Dialogues.Speaker: Clever Nikolas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I speak of fate, of course.

Dialogues.Speaker: Clever Nikolas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These figurines I brought were crafted by my family for me and my brother, as a rite of passage. They're made in our likeness.

Dialogues.Speaker: Clever Nikolas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're twins, but we walked two very different paths. Me, books and knowledge, and him, weapons and strength.

Dialogues.Speaker: Clever Nikolas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By chance, I learned my brother's fate in Tetragon Temple. Destined to die this summer at the hands of a Tacet Discord. They couldn't see my fate, so here I am now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Clever Nikolas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I want to see whether fate will once again lead me down a path opposite my brother?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (An older, more aged Nikolas... peaceful... Dead at fifty? No, at least sixty...)

Options.PlotLineKey: (Recount exactly what you saw.)
(Probe into his intentions first.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Clever Nikolas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...So I'm right! Hahaha, see! Kyrion, my brother... What did I tell you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Clever Nikolas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...We were born identical, after all. I know him well. If I wanted to imitate him, even our parents wouldn't be able to tell us apart. But fate? What would it do?

Dialogues.Speaker: Clever Nikolas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've shown me my end. I will live to become an old man. That means this summer I won't die.

Dialogues.Speaker: Clever Nikolas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What if I take Kyrion's place in the battle? And he plays the part of Nikolas, sailing across the seas? I'll confuse the whole world, even fate itself...

Dialogues.Speaker: Clever Nikolas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let me try. I'll use fate's prophecy to overturn another, and trick death with the undying!

Options.PlotLineKey: Bold. I don't hate it.
Who knows, it might work.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
As Priestess Iuno of the past, you sit on the altar offering prophecies to those who seek guidance.

The third to come is Nikolas, a noble youth desperate to outwit fate. Another Priestess has prophesied that his twin brother will die at the hands of a beast this summer. But you foresee Nikolas living to old age. He wonders: if he takes his brother's place in battle, can he cheat death? Can one prophecy cancel another?
The fourth to come is Maia, a young, innocent girl. She...

Dialogues.Speaker: Innocent Maia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phew... Oh, Priestess, is it true that if I give you the right thing, you can see everything?

Options.PlotLineKey: (Reply confidently. Iuno would do the same.)
(Reply cautiously. Insights depend on the situation.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Innocent Maia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wow, you're amazing! I can tell you're different from all the other Priestesses!

Dialogues.Speaker: Innocent Maia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You look so serious... but everyone says you're the most powerful Priestess. If it's not you, I don't know who else to ask.

Dialogues.Speaker: Innocent Maia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look, Grandpa made this bottle. Can you see where he went? And what did he turn into?

Dialogues.Speaker: Innocent Maia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I want to find him quickly. He left so fast... he must've forgotten to tell me!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (It's dark... Nothing but darkness. I don't see anything. What does it mean?)

Options.PlotLineKey: (Recount what you saw truthfully.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Innocent Maia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see. The Priestesses at the Temple said they saw the same thing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Innocent Maia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They said when someone dies, their light goes out... and everything left is just pitch black, nobody can see anything anymore.

Options.PlotLineKey: So your grandfather is already...

Dialogues.Speaker: Innocent Maia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. Grandpa was really sick and he... died.
