Dialogues.Speaker: Innocent Maia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But it's okay! He made me promise that if he ever wasn't here anymore, I'd put all my tears in this bottle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Innocent Maia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One day when the tears dry up, we'll see each other again!

Dialogues.Speaker: Innocent Maia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So I don't cry anymore. I'm worried it'll take a really, really long time to see him again... Just how long exactly? What will Grandpa look like then?

Dialogues.Speaker: Innocent Maia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can be forgetful sometimes... What if I don't recognize him, what then?!

Options.PlotLineKey: (Tell her a kind lie wrapped in the illusion of prophecy.)
(Tell her the real truth beyond any prophecy.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait... I see a flicker of light in the dark. It's one of your favorite things... it's...

Dialogues.Speaker: Innocent Maia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A butterfly! I love butterflies!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. When your tears dry, your grandfather will return to you as a butterfly. When he does, you'll know it's him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Innocent Maia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you! Priestess, I knew you could do it... Even if nobody else believed me, I just knew there would be someone who could see!

Dialogues.Speaker: Innocent Maia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I don't believe it. I don't believe you! Grandpa didn't lie to me!

Dialogues.Speaker: Innocent Maia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Grandpa wouldn't lie to me... I must've given you the wrong thing. Or maybe you're just not as powerful as they say you are!

Dialogues.Speaker: Innocent Maia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I believed in all of you Priestesses, that's why I came! But you... don't believe me. It doesn't matter if you can see or not! I'm not giving up!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
As Priestess Iuno of the past, you sit on the altar offering prophecies to those who seek guidance.

The fourth to come is Maia, a young, innocent girl carrying a glass bottle filled with tears over an impossible promise made by her ailing grandfather. Will you comfort her with a kind lie, letting her believe he will return when the tears dry, or tell her the harsh truth that he's gone?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Main_Linaxita_2_10_362_28

Chapters.Title: Walk down the divination altar with Iuno
Move through the crowd and continue forward

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's rest here, one more time.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anchor these memories and connections. Make them a part of you.

Chapters.Title: Find Iuno and take her hand
Sit next to the Lunarum Bough with Iuno

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can see further than anyone else. I can see things no one else can...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've seen things others can't begin to imagine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So why... why, at the moment I should've seen the clearest, did I close my eyes and shut it out?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was so close... If I hadn't... closed my eyes...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I would've learned the causal chain, and I could've stopped it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After that, I decided to keep my eyes wide open, no matter the cost.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll sit at the crossroads of fate. I'll stare into what's to come and not flinch, be it joyful, tragic, rebirth, destruction...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Until I see it all. Until I know everything.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Because I'm stronger than anyone else. This is something only I can do. But—

Dialogues.Speaker: Gladiator Harelius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "If the Priestess's prophecies were really perfect, we could avoid all misfortune..."

Dialogues.Speaker: Clever Nikolas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "If there is such a thing as fate, then misfortunes cannot be avoided..."

Dialogues.Speaker: Infatuated Samara
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Just because you know the outcome, doesn't mean the journey isn't worth it!"

Dialogues.Speaker: Disillusioned Maia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "If life is destined to follow a predetermined path, does it even matter if we know our fate?"

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After all I see... could I ever answer what they hope of me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Does glimpsing one's fate really matter?

Options.PlotLineKey: I understand why you stopped offering prophecies.
You weren't sure if seeing the future alone was really enough.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Unwritten... You are as sharp as ever.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Seeing is simple. But facing what you see isn't.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In your eyes, I see my past self. I also see my present self. Together, they overlap to create a more complete version of me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Light streams from the bracelet. You've learned how to draw out Iuno's memories, and you wait as they reveal more of her hidden past. The girl who should have watched her mother's death unfold instinctively chose to shut her eyes. After losing the chance to change anything, she vowed to see everything from then on, no matter the cost. That vow led her to become a Priestess. But after countless prophecies, she began to question whether "seeing" truly meant understanding. The Lunarum Bough continues to grow, and the Iuno beside you slowly becomes more whole.

Chapters.Title: Find Iuno and take her hand

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We can't continue the Anchoring.

Chapters.Title: Take Iuno's hand and continue forward

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Still giving prophecies, Iuno?

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Like the first time we met on the plains, you told me you saw a glory as bright as the sun. One that would earn me respect.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Truth be told, I didn't think much of your words back then.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When I want something, no one's permission is needed. Nothing could stand between me and my goal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When the prophecy came true though, I found it... unsatisfying.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Imagine thinking you are the master of your own fate, only to learn, for better or for worse, everything you are is part of fate's design.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's as if fate chips away at the untamed part of you, turning you from a wolf into a caged rabbit.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And you... you saw it all so easily. Truths as clear as the moonlight. Bright, yet distant and cold.

Options.PlotLineKey: If that's the case, why did you seek out the Priestess?
I know you are not one to believe in prophecies.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't mistake me. I don't dismiss the value of prophecy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, quite the opposite. I do recognize the Priestesses' abilities.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Seeing the outcome gives us insight. Prophecies allow us to envision the future and find better ways to face it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In every one of Septimont's Auguries, the Priestesses foresaw disasters that would befall the land, but also the hero who would rise up to face it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Like the people of Septimont, I too have been blessed by prophecy. But in the end, whether disaster is averted or who the hero is... those choices are never ours.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If we are nothing more than fate's puppets, what difference does it make if we can see its hand?

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If fate one day wills our annihilation, with no way to change it, what then is the role of a Priestess?

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are they merely fate's mouthpiece, bowing to its will? Or... are they pioneers, seeking to shape what's to come?

Options.PlotLineKey: Is this about Septimont's Auguries?
Be straight with me. What really brings you here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Last night, Grandmother Lillibet told me another Septimont Augury had emerged. This one revealed a future unseen, a warning long overdue...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An unknown disaster that would bring about the end of Septimont.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The vision was unclear. The Priestess couldn't discern the cause of the disaster, nor could they see the hero who would rise up to stop it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Senate prefers to wait, believing the solution will reveal itself in time. But I must consider the darker possibility.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know that you'd rather be out there dealing with living, breathing people than confined to the Temple to await some grand future. You, too, are tired of the Senate's rules and the Priestesses' chains.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But as a prodigy in prophecy, you should see further than Lillibet or any of the other Priestesses.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Would you dare, with no direction, no clues, and not a single focus item, gaze upon Septimont's end and trace its cause?

Options.PlotLineKey: Agree to Augusta's proposal. Search for Septimont's ending.
Reject Augusta's proposal. Wait for time to reveal more insights.

Dialogues.Speaker: Possible Choice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "So be it. I'll make this prophecy's ending my answer."

Dialogues.Speaker: Possible Choice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "End or future... If I can break through the maze and find the Hero of Heroes they could not, I won't need to worry about the meaning of what I see. I will be the meaning I see."

Dialogues.Speaker: Possible Choice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Countless souls have come to me for prophecies, and I've never held back. But in the end, all I do is relay what I see, down to the smallest detail."

Dialogues.Speaker: Possible Choice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Whether I intervene or not, what's destined to happen will come to pass. If we are but fate's puppets, what difference does it make if we see the future?"

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anchoring cannot continue.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There are countless possibilities, but what's done is done. Only one past can bring you to the present you seek.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You encounter Augusta in the Chaos who mistakes you for Iuno, like the others you've met. She poses a difficult question: when fate offers no solution and only promises annihilation, what then is the role of a Priestess? Would you dare, with no direction or clues, gaze upon Septimont's destruction and trace its cause? You understand your answer doesn't matter. What matters is how Iuno would answer that question.

Chapters.Title: Talk to Augusta

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Would you dare, with no direction, no clues, and not a single focus item, gaze upon Septimont's end and trace its cause?

Options.PlotLineKey: (Agree to Augusta's proposal. Search for Septimont's ending.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Possible Choice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "So be it. I'll make this prophecy's ending my answer."

Dialogues.Speaker: Possible Choice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "End or future... If I can break through the maze and find the Hero of Heroes they could not, I won't need to worry about the meaning of what I see. I will be the meaning I see."

Chapters.Title: Find Iuno and take her hand

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once again, I repeat Iuno's past choice.

Chapters.Title: Observe the surroundings and walk around

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Over there, it looks familiar... Perhaps we can stop to take a breath and rest, if only for a moment.

Options.PlotLineKey: You think there are Lunarum Boughs?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't know, but something about it is different.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I must've been there before and done something... something important.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: None of the other places felt like this.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But why is it so ruined, so silent? There should be people, and more light, like how it was when it all began...

Options.PlotLineKey: Let's go find out why this place feels important to you.

Chapters.Title: Find Iuno and take her hand
Defeat the manifestations of Chaos

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's Chaos. It found us.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those things... are manifestations of Chaos.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Be careful, they're closing in.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh... it really insists that I stay.

Chapters.Title: Defeat the manifestations of Chaos

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I... I remember now.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This place is where it all began.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's also where it ended...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's okay... Run...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Iuno"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Go there...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Go there? The Dark Tide is starting to surge...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Have to get there before I'm swallowed too.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that another one of Chaos's tricks?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't get in my way.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Got to hurry. Running out of time.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That way!

Chapters.Title: Enter the ruins

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Manifestations of Chaos... Where is it taking Iuno? How can I find her?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Iuno wanted to come here... What did she remember? What's different about this place? When she said it's where it ended... does that mean it's the way out?)

Chapters.Title: Enter the ruins

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Did Iuno leave these lights to guide me?)

Chapters.Title: Investigate around and look for clues

Dialogues.Speaker: Gladiator Ethan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Those cursed creatures! If it weren't for the Dark Tide... we would've killed them all already!"

Dialogues.Speaker: Gladiator Aurora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "We couldn't activate the Anchor Stone before they destroyed it. Now it's over, everything's ruined..."

Dialogues.Speaker: Gladiator Ethan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Harelius, we shouldn't have come here. We've lost everything. The Priestess saw it all... What in bloody skies made her insist on coming with us?"

Chapters.Title: Investigate further
Investigate around and look for more clues

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (This calcification is severe. Such corruption... the Dark Tide's surge just now wouldn't be enough to cause this.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Could this be connected to the important event Iuno mentioned before she was taken?)

Chapters.Title: Investigate around and look for more clues

Dialogues.Speaker: Gladiator Harelius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "First David and Lilian, then Ari, Vincentius, Perla... Now even Anassa. Please, Iuno, weren't you able to help us before?"

Dialogues.Speaker: Gladiator Harelius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Just like when you told us to use a spear against the Tacet Discord, help us see something again! You must be able to see something..."

Dialogues.Speaker: Gladiator Ethan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "All of us, doomed to die? If that's true, why did you come with us... just to watch us die?!"

Dialogues.Speaker: Gladiator Aurora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "No, the Dark Tide's corruption is spread too wide. It's covering their retreat, we can't catch them. The moonlight offered us some illumination, but—"

Dialogues.Speaker: Gladiator Aurora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Now it too... is being swallowed by the Dark Tide!"

Chapters.Title: Continue exploring
Investigate around and look for more clues

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks familiar... A Priestess's candelabrum？

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How did it get so damaged?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why? Why... why?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hundreds of days and nights spent in fate's embrace, staring at the end.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I tried to see everything, missing nothing... but not once did I see a single future where Septimont still stands.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, this is the answer you give me—

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To know our inevitable doom, then tell the people of Septimont to wait for it, accept it, and even be grateful?

Dialogues.Speaker: Struggling Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Priestess, what more do you hope to achieve?

Dialogues.Speaker: Infatuated Samara
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Priestess, what more can you do?

Dialogues.Speaker: Clever Nikolas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haven't you... already seen it all, plain as day?

Dialogues.Speaker: Confident Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haven't you seen it countless times already?

Dialogues.Speaker: Disillusioned Maia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haven't you already viewed the answer?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, I saw it. A clear, undeniable future. I know... all I need to do is convince myself this is the final answer...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... how could I ever accept it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How could I be content?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With our very existence being denied like this?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Who are you to decide Septimont's fate?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Certainty... is just the narrow boundary fate sets for us. The immeasurable, the free... That is where our dignity lies!

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A mouthpiece, a silent witness... Heh, if this is what you expect of me...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll raise my bow and turn fate into a storm of possibility!

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If, just once, I can prove you are not fixed, then will this so-called "end" even—

Dialogues.Speaker: Gladiator Harelius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait, Priestess Iuno... Are you really going to stand with us against the Dark Tide?

Dialogues.Speaker: Gladiator Harelius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've already... seen how it ends, haven't you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm doing this because it's what I want.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The answer I seek is one only I can give.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After countless days and nights of divination, not a single prophecy showed Septimont surviving. Still, Iuno refused to accept that fate. To her, human dignity lay in defying what was predetermined. When Harelius returned seeking guidance, she cast her candelabrum into the Dark Tide and walked toward the unknown beyond Tetragon Temple. By joining Harelius's squad in battle, if she could prove fate could be changed, even once, then Septimont's fated destruction would no longer be absolute.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fate unveils itself to the Priestess.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Following its guidance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She reaches the end, again and again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Foreseeing its conclusion.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heads fall.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whimpers fade.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She sees no Hero of Heroes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Variables added.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Visions expanded.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She sees no Hero of Heroes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Beyond a doubt.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No other choice.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She sees no Hero of Heroes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Priestess is never wrong.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But she despises her own truth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For her success is Septimont's defeat.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why... is it always defeat?

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "If fate one day wills our annihilation..."

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "If we are nothing more than fate's puppets..."

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When that time comes...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What good is a Priestess?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Septimont will be no more.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nothing will remain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Only she who foresaw every death still lives.

Chapters.Title: Continue forward and leave the ruins
Approach the Lunarum Bough

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Lunarum Boughs have grown strong. You've done well with your Anchoring.

Options.PlotLineKey: How did you know I was doing that?
Who are you, really?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look at you, a mortal from the real world stumbling into Chaos. What else would you be here for, if not to take something back with you？

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Also, with that thing on your wrist there... Isn't it clear? That's how she's been connected to you all this time. Only Anchoring explains that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for your second question, that's even stranger.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Along the way, you met the Priestesses, Gladiators, and many others chasing prophecies... Did you ever stop to wonder who they were?

Options.PlotLineKey: You gave me a strange feeling, so I asked.
You're the only one who doesn't clearly belong to any past.
You seem to know a lot more than you're letting on.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What is it you expect to hear then, mmm?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm a blacksmith, long dead. Once a forger of weapons.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A father to a daughter.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A reflection of her past in the Chaos.

Options.PlotLineKey: So you can tell that I'm not really Iuno.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aye. But just like the question of who I am, that's not the point.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What matters isn't me, but you. Isn't that right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You noticed, didn't you? The more you rested near the Lunarum Boughs, the more memories and connections manifested into reality. Iuno's specter became more real, and the Boughs grew.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But now, Chaos has that specter. After all, it was never truly Iuno, was it? But the Lunarum Bough, that's what the two of you built along the way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There'll be no more doors to choose from. You can keep the Bough and take it back with you. Find a new specter to follow. As long as you have it with you, that should be enough.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Or... do you still want to forge it into a bow?

Options.PlotLineKey: Heh, still choices to make, but more intangible.
Aren't you asking me to make a choice now?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We were gathering Lunarum Boughs to forge the bow.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just like... I came here only to Anchor her and bring her back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you cut it here, all your previous Anchoring will be for nothing. You might have to start over many times, with things going even less smoothly. Are you willing?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not to mention, being trapped in Chaos for so long... There's a chance she's already forgotten her will to fight.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you sure you want to throw away all the certainty you've built, just to gamble on a possibility?

Options.PlotLineKey: Isn't that what I've done from the start?
If I start over, maybe I'll do it better next time.
I'm sure. I have to try.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Forgotten... to fight? I don't know who you think she is, but the Iuno I know is not someone to give in so easily.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She promised we'd meet at the end. As long as Iuno needs a bow, I'll be the one to carry it for her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha, I always thought you followed the light's guidance. Now I see, you reached this point because the light followed you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How could I forget? The greatest archery isn't about hitting the target every time. It's about letting the arrow choose the mark. Wherever it lands, that's where destiny awaits.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've said it before. I forge weapons. If you still want it, I'll forge the bow for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bow-Forging Blacksmith
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come then. Let's do it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You return to the now fully grown Lunarum Bough and talk with the blacksmith again. While there's clearly more to him than meets the eye, what matters now is that the Bough's growth has strengthened the anchoring of Iuno's memories and connections. Even though Iuno's specter you've been trying to make whole was taken by the Dark Tide, as long as the Lunarum Bough remains, there is still hope to find another trace of her in the Chaos.

Remembering your promise to Iuno to meet at the very end, you decide to gamble everything on the chance of finding her again in the Dark Tide. You ask the blacksmith to fulfill his promise of making the Moon Bow to give to Iuno.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cough...
Iuno... Priestess Iuno...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This again... My head's spinning, my arms and legs... It's like I'm underwater. So heavy...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I saw {PlayerName}... at the divination altar at the agora... And then...
Go back, Priestess Iuno.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Harelius? What are you doing here? Didn't Chaos just take me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This place must be... where I gave my last prophecy three years ago. At the end of the spring basin, where the Dark Tide surged!

Dialogues.Speaker: Gladiator Harelius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Priestess Iuno, we're already indebted to you for accompanying us on this journey.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gladiator Harelius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But you've seen how it ends. Our squad is doomed... The others and I are fated to fall here. There's no need for you to risk your own life any longer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gladiator Harelius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Return to Tetragon Temple. That's where you should be. I too... will go where I should be.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Words fit for the abyss. Don't you dare underestimate me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Where to go, what path to take... That's something only I decide!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After being taken by the Dark Tide, Iuno awakens alone at the edge of Chaos. She finds herself standing on the battlefield from three years ago. Having foreseen Harelius and his squad wiped out, she had decided to stop being a passive observer of fate and instead fight in their battle against the Dark Tide.

Chapters.Title: Support the Gladiators in the depths of the Dark Tide
Defeat the Dark Tide creations

Dialogues.Speaker: Weak Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you... the Priestess Harelius spoke of?

Dialogues.Speaker: Exhausted Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you... Back there, closer to the surge... They need...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't push yourself. After what you've just been through, it's enough that you're still on your feet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Treat your wounds first. Leave the backup to me.

Chapters.Title: Support the Gladiators in the depths of the Dark Tide
Support the Gladiators in the depths of the Dark Tide

Dialogues.Speaker: Injured Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Th-thank you... I feel much better. I can still—

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Definitely not. You're too wounded. Before worrying about them, make sure they don't need to worry about you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know what you're planning. I'll go in your stead.

Chapters.Title: Reach the end of the battlefield

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cowardly, blighted bastards! Always hiding in the Dark Tide...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then I'll send you right back into it!

Chapters.Title: Protect the Gladiators on the field

Dialogues.Speaker: Gladiator Harelius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh... Cough, cough... Priestess Iuno, thank you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Gladiator Harelius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You... And all of us... Have done well...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will not let you fall!

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is pure torture... How can I let it end like this again...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Again, as always...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But why... Would I just stand by and watch you, accept you, complete you?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No. Even if the end is here, unavoidable, I still have the right to refuse.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Lunarum Bough has grown strong...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From now on, I need no one's guidance—

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Because wherever I choose to aim is my true destiny!

Chapters.Title: Eliminate the Dark Tide creations

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look closely. Before you isn't a moon the Dark Tide can devour...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It is a moon I command!

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I made myself the arrow so you will answer to me! No escape. No retreat. No way out!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I told you I'd rewrite the ending you changed!

Chapters.Title: Talk to Iuno

Options.PlotLineKey: You look... completely restored.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. We've come out of the Chaos between life and death, between existence and non-existence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There aren't any guiding traces, no visions of fate's hand. It's just you and me and... our own grasp of what's to come.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Compared to before, now what we see is...

Options.PlotLineKey: An unwritten void.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. Stretching as far as the eye can see, an infinite... void. More vast than what I saw within you, or anything I glimpsed in the future.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So this is what our changed ending looks like?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No longer an indeterminate chaos, or a singular answer given by someone... but an infinite sea of possibility awaiting choice.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seems like there's nothing, but in truth, there's everything. So this is the true meaning of a void.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now... it's time to leave this place.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The dust settles after that final moment of the battle. No more Chaos. No more Dark Tide. All you see is Iuno standing before you, framed by an infinite white void. Is this the changed ending? Did you really unlock infinite possibility? You can't be sure, but within the vastness of this blank void, Iuno tells you it's time to leave.

Chapters.Title: Leave the Chaos and return to the real world

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait... Why is it only me?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Where's Iuno?!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The way into Chaos has closed. Lillibet's not here either. Did the Anchoring fail? Or is it not over yet?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (But Iuno and I made it to the very end. Does this mean... this is the new ending I created?)

Chapters.Title: Ride the Wingray and return to the Hunter's Den

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For a moment, you can't quite tell...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Were those times with Iuno real... or just a dream?

Chapters.Title: Return to the Hunter's Den
Find Grandmother Lillibet

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I don't see Lillibet anywhere. I'll ask those Priestesses over there.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't you think it's odd...

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 2
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Grandmother Lillibet also said...

Chapters.Title: Talk to the Priestess and ask about the situation

Dialogues.Speaker: Doubtful Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't you think it's odd? Even if we can't see the next part of Septimont's Auguries, it still shouldn't be such a white blank?

Dialogues.Speaker: Surprised Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Grandmother Lillibet also said that for the first time, some of her records in Septimont's Auguries were rewritten...

Options.PlotLineKey: Seems like some things changed, after all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Surprised Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, it's like there's a whole new part to the story... Huh? Wait, aren't you who they call the Unwritten One?

Dialogues.Speaker: Doubtful Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is our first time meeting you in person.

Options.PlotLineKey: I'm looking for Grandmother Lillibet.
Do you know where Grandmother Lillibet went?

Dialogues.Speaker: Doubtful Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She returned not long ago. She was here just now... Oh, I think I know where she went. Underground.

Dialogues.Speaker: Doubtful Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't know why, but things just keep happening today.

Dialogues.Speaker: Doubtful Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Apparently, that Avidius locked up below overheard the Priestesses talking about some prophecy and escaped, just like that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Doubtful Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I think Lillibet must've gone to handle the situation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Surprised Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, that's not it. Avidius wasn't being locked up. He chose to stay here. If he wanted to leave, Lillibet wouldn't worry about him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Surprised Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I think she was called away to the celebration?

Dialogues.Speaker: Surprised Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah yes, I saw a girl with two blue... or was it black, ponytails. Grandmother Lillibet went to the celebration with her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Doubtful Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That makes sense. It must've started by now then! Before the oration ends, Lillibet would definitely need to be there.

Options.PlotLineKey: (Ponytails...)
(Did Iuno make it back?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you know... who Iuno is?

Dialogues.Speaker: Surprised Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Iuno? I don't think I've heard that name before. Do you mean that's the girl we're talking about?

Dialogues.Speaker: Surprised Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Apologies, I didn't have a good look at her...

Dialogues.Speaker: Doubtful Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've only just become Priestesses. There is much we still don't know about this land. Maybe she was Iuno?

Dialogues.Speaker: Doubtful Priestess
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If it's important, perhaps you might try looking for her at the celebration?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Upon returning from Chaos, you discover some records in Lillibet's Book of Prophecies have been overwritten, proof that what you did made a difference. After hearing the Priestesses in discussion, you're certain that things have changed. They mention a girl with two blue ponytails. Could it be Iuno? Following their suggestion, you step into the celebrating crowd to search for her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ceremonial Officer Bruno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Drinks, fine food, orations... The Rosebearers milling about... Yes, everything is just perfect! Hm, {PlayerName}?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ceremonial Officer Bruno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was just saying how the celebration is nearing its most glorious part. You've come here... for more petals to hand out?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ceremonial Officer Bruno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Or would you like me to recommend another interesting part of the ceremony?

Options.PlotLineKey: Neither, actually. I'm looking for someone...
Do you know a girl called Iuno?
Have you seen a girl with dark blue ponytails?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ceremonial Officer Bruno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah... the name has a lovely ring to it, but I'm afraid I don't.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ceremonial Officer Bruno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ponytails, dark blue... My apologies, but I don't think I have.

Options.PlotLineKey: I see. Thanks, I'll try my luck elsewhere.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ceremonial Officer Bruno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In a celebration this grand, it's easy to get separated... I'll keep an eye out for her for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Veteran Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, it's {PlayerName}, eh? How've you been holding up?

Dialogues.Speaker: Veteran Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since you've kept your distance from the Dark Tide, how're things? The bow, the girl... those daydreams of yours get any better?

Options.PlotLineKey: Kept my distance? I even went right back into it.
Daydreams? You still don't seem to remember Iuno.
Have you seen a girl with dark blue ponytails?

Dialogues.Speaker: Veteran Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm, let me think. Plenty of fresh faces here. But dark blue ponytails... Ah, I think I saw a girl like that!

Dialogues.Speaker: Veteran Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She walked like a cat, as nimble as they come... Seems she was looking for someone, too? She was just over there...

Options.PlotLineKey: I'll head there now!

Chapters.Title: Return to the celebration

Dialogues.Speaker: Valiant Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come on over! Toast!

Dialogues.Speaker: Outspoken Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's drink till we drop!

Dialogues.Speaker: Worried Noble
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We should just live in the moment and enjoy what we have now...

Dialogues.Speaker: Helpful Noble
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's more like it!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ceremonial Officer Bruno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come, triumphant rain of petals...

Dialogues.Speaker: Ceremonial Officer Bruno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Make it even grander...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Didn't you tell me we would meet at the very end? Then why can't I find you...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I could hear your voice from a distance, "Iuno, Iuno!" Wasn't that it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Seems like you're in an awful hurry to find someone.

Options.PlotLineKey: You little... Do you know how worried I was?
Back to cracking jokes. Guess we're good now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I thought you'd like this, us slipping back into our old, familiar rhythm... Now you know I'm still me. And yes, I really am back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Exactly. See? I come right away and stand before you, in the flesh.

Options.PlotLineKey: Okay, now's the time to talk.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's just like you saw at the end of the Chaos. Three years ago, at the end of the spring basin swallowed by the Dark Tide, I, as a Priestess, made my choice.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was so done with just being dragged along by the moon's whims... So I defied fate, severed the path, and became the arrow that struck at destiny itself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After that, I lost the ability to see clear visions of the future, but in return, I gained the power to anchor the Dark Tide's creations.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With that, the last prophecy I saw changed slightly. In a squad doomed to fall, one survived—Harelius.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If I can do it once, then I can do it a second time, then a third... Perhaps one day, I can overturn more destined futures.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since fate didn't prepare a Hero of Heroes, we decided to eliminate the need for one by taking on the disaster at its source—the Sovereign and the Paradise.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is the plan Augusta and I made, though I did hide the teeny tiny cost.

Options.PlotLineKey: Your disappearance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, all the Septimontians who were supposed to die are still alive. The end I once foresaw has changed. The meaning of this has already transcended my own existence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So then, even if every trace of my "existence" was erased, who can say that the altered fate I left behind isn't proof of my existence?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: More importantly, I had the privilege of standing by your side to witness what lies beyond the end. The void. An unwritten... void. Perhaps it signifies the unimaginable possibilities yet to come.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just like you, bringing unknown possibilities to Septimont... and to me.

Options.PlotLineKey: Let's make sure there's no next time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why, sacrificing myself? Or just trying something I'm not sure about?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come now, you know me... I follow my whims. And the more I trust someone, the harder it is to keep my impulses in check.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm not one to make promises I can't keep, but I'll promise you this... if there is a next time, you'll be the first to know.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And when I do, you'll get the full story. No holding back.

Options.PlotLineKey: Do the people remember you now?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've run into a few friends since being back. Not one of them recognized me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Guess the memory of the Iuno they once knew is just... the price we had to pay.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But, at least... you still remember me. You pulled me from the Chaos and brought me back to existence. That's enough.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, I'm certain Augusta and I, along with the rest of them, will be thick as thieves again, this time creating new futures. You really shouldn't underestimate my charm!

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh yes, and this bracelet...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is the second time I've given this to you. Never mind the first time, but I wouldn't refuse a second time, if I were you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Being the second time means there's been a change... Now, it's a testament to our secret little interactions. I've Anchored the world, and you, you've Anchored me.

Options.PlotLineKey: (Accept the bracelet and put it on.)
(Accept the bracelet and put it away.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You search the crowd, but she's nowhere to be found... A flicker of doubt crosses your mind. Didn't she promise to "meet you in the very end"? Then, under a beam of moonlight, a hand gently taps your shoulder. In that familiar, playful way, Iuno greets you. She's back, whole and real, and she begins to tell you everything—what happened three years ago, and what brought her here now.

She explains that as a Priestess, she grew tired of simply watching. She broke free from fate's decree and became the arrow that defied it. Her disappearance was just part of the cost to anchor herself and rewrite what was meant to be. Now, you've given Septimont a future unwritten, and given her one too.

As a gift, she gives you the Lunarum bracelet you returned once again. Besides you, the world may still have forgotten her, but she still has her present and her future. And that's enough. As the celebration reaches its peak, Iuno takes your hand and leads you into a glorious shower of petals.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Main_Linaxita_2_10_63_61

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Main_Linaxita_2_10_63_62

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for any matter pertaining to me... What you saw in the Chaos and what transpired, do not breathe a word of it to another soul. Understand?

Options.PlotLineKey: Feeling bashful all of a sudden?
It will be our little secret then.
That so? I'll keep it in mind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmph, bashful? Hardly! If you blurt it out, it would cause quite a stir. All that explaining would be too much hassle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Besides, to them, I am... quite the anomaly. If the truth came out, the first reaction would be shock.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You think so too? Okay. Good. I'm most relieved.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You think so too? Okay. Good. I'm most relieved.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, then again, this is a perfect opportunity to start anew.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In Septimont, it would be a crime to miss the height of the celebration.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After fighting side by side, we share honey and wine under a rain of petals, drinking to our hearts' content... Surely you've heard of this little tradition of ours, haven't you, Unwritten One?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come on, let's go. Together... to be drenched in those rose petals that smell of glory and triumph.
